ArticleTitle.sentence: Rel/NF-kappa B transcription factors and the control of apoptosis.

event.clue: Rel/NF-kappa B transcription factors and the control of apoptosis.

AbstractText.sentence: The process of apoptosis is used to eliminate unwanted cells from a wide variety of organisms.

event.clue: The process of apoptosis is used to eliminate unwanted cells from a wide variety of organisms.

AbstractText.sentence: Various extracellular signals, often converging in common intracellular pathways, can induce apoptosis in a cell-type-specific fashion.

event.clue: Various extracellular signals, often converging in common intracellular pathways, can induce apoptosis in a cell-type-specific fashion.
Various extracellular signals, often converging in common intracellular pathways, can induce apoptosis in a cell-type-specific fashion.

AbstractText.sentence: Recent work from several laboratories has demonstrated that Rel/NF-kappa B transcription factors regulate apoptosis in many cell types.

event.clue: Recent work from several laboratories has demonstrated that Rel/NF-kappa B transcription factors regulate apoptosis in many cell types.

AbstractText.sentence: In most cells, Rel/NF-kappa B transcription factors appear to mediate survival signals that protect cells from apoptosis; however, under some circumstances, activation of these factors may also promote apoptosis.

event.clue: In most cells, Rel/NF-kappa B transcription factors appear to mediate survival signals that protect cells from apoptosis; however, under some circumstances, activation of these factors may also promote apoptosis.
